title: ==> Error: TypeError: expected str, bytes or os.PathLike object, not NoneType

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
<!-- Explain, in a clear and concise way, the command you ran and the result you were trying to achieve.
Example: "I ran `spack find` to list all the installed packages and ..." -->

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
(base) warndt@cori08:~> git clone https://github.com/spack/spack.git
Cloning into 'spack'...
remote: Enumerating objects: 79, done.
remote: Counting objects: 100% (79/79), done.
remote: Compressing objects: 100% (69/69), done.
remote: Total 269924 (delta 28), reused 1 (delta 0), pack-reused 269845
Receiving objects: 100% (269924/269924), 108.53 MiB | 20.29 MiB/s, done.
Resolving deltas: 100% (113818/113818), done.
Checking out files: 100% (7834/7834), done.
(base) warndt@cori08:~> cd spack/bin
(base) warndt@cori08:~/spack/bin> ./spack install zlib
==> Installing zlib-1.2.11-qc2sg7pqaekt7vmovo4jzn33gjm4wtaa
==> No binary for zlib-1.2.11-qc2sg7pqaekt7vmovo4jzn33gjm4wtaa found: installing from source
==> Error: TypeError: expected str, bytes or os.PathLike object, not NoneType

/global/u1/w/warndt/spack/lib/spack/spack/build_environment.py:872, in _setup_pkg_and_run:
        869        tb_string = traceback.format_exc()
        870
        871        # build up some context from the offending package so we can
  >>    872        # show that, too.
        873        package_context = get_package_context(tb)
        874
        875        logfile = None


(base) warndt@cori08:~/spack/bin>  

```

Also tried "libelf" instead of "zlib" and got same outcome.


### Information on your system

<!-- Please include the output of `spack debug report` -->

This is on Cori at NERSC. I also tried the spack install with our module. Same outcome.

(base) warndt@cori08:~/spack/bin> ./spack debug report
* **Spack:** 0.16.1-1694-f213cf8349
* **Python:** 3.7.4
* **Platform:** cray-sles15-haswell
* **Concretizer:** original

<!-- If you have any relevant configuration detail (custom `packages.yaml` or `modules.yaml`, etc.) you can add that here as well. -->

### debug mode version
```
(base) warndt@cori08:~/spack/bin> ./spack -d install zlib

/global/u1/w/warndt/spack/lib/spack/spack/build_environment.py:872, in _setup_pkg_and_run:
        869        tb_string = traceback.format_exc()
        870
        871        # build up some context from the offending package so we can
  >>    872        # show that, too.
        873        package_context = get_package_context(tb)
        874

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/global/u1/w/warndt/spack/lib/spack/spack/build_environment.py", line 855, in _setup_pkg_and_run
    context=context)
  File "/global/u1/w/warndt/spack/lib/spack/spack/build_environment.py", line 753, in setup_package
    set_module_variables_for_package(pkg)
  File "/global/u1/w/warndt/spack/lib/spack/spack/build_environment.py", line 544, in set_module_variables_for_package
    _set_variables_for_single_module(pkg, mod)
  File "/global/u1/w/warndt/spack/lib/spack/spack/build_environment.py", line 487, in _set_variables_for_single_module
    m.std_cmake_args = spack.build_systems.cmake.CMakePackage._std_args(pkg)
  File "/global/u1/w/warndt/spack/lib/spack/spack/build_systems/cmake.py", line 187, in _std_args
    spack.build_environment.get_rpaths(pkg)),
  File "/global/u1/w/warndt/spack/lib/spack/spack/build_environment.py", line 656, in get_rpaths
    return list(dedupe(filter_system_paths(rpaths)))
  File "/global/u1/w/warndt/spack/lib/spack/spack/util/environment.py", line 61, in filter_system_paths
    return [p for p in paths if not is_system_path(p)]
  File "/global/u1/w/warndt/spack/lib/spack/spack/util/environment.py", line 61, in <listcomp>
    return [p for p in paths if not is_system_path(p)]
  File "/global/u1/w/warndt/spack/lib/spack/spack/util/environment.py", line 56, in is_system_path
    return os.path.normpath(path) in system_dirs
  File "/global/common/cori_cle7/software/python/3.7-anaconda-2019.10/lib/python3.7/posixpath.py", line 340, in normpath
    path = os.fspath(path)
TypeError: expected str, bytes or os.PathLike object, not NoneType
==> [2021-03-12-12:48:54.228580] Flagging zlib-1.2.11-qc2sg7pqaekt7vmovo4jzn33gjm4wtaa as failed: TypeError: expected str, bytes or os.PathLike object, not NoneType
==> [2021-03-12-12:48:54.232688] ChildError: TypeError: expected str, bytes or os.PathLike object, not NoneType
```

### Additional information

<!-- These boxes can be checked by replacing [ ] with [x] or by clicking them after submitting the issue. -->
- [x] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
- [x] I have run the failing commands in debug mode and reported the output

<!-- We encourage you to try, as much as possible, to reduce your problem to the minimal example that still reproduces the issue. That would help us a lot in fixing it quickly and effectively!

If you want to ask a question about the tool (how to use it, what it can currently do, etc.), try the `#general` channel on our Slack first. We have a welcoming community and chances are you'll get your reply faster and without opening an issue.

Other than that, thanks for taking the time to contribute to Spack! -->
